dfischer.utils

Class AlertConfigGenericDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.AlertConfigGenericDevice
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AlertConfigClickatellHTTPSMSServerDevice, AlertConfigSMTPServerDevice

    public abstract class AlertConfigGenericDevice
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract basis class for all alert devices.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AlertConfigGenericDevice

        public AlertConfigGenericDevice()
        Object transfer constructor

    • Method Detail

      • startAlertTransmitQueue

        public void startAlertTransmitQueue(AlertConfig alertConfig,
                           int[] retryAttemptSecondsArray)
        Transient: add an alert transmit queue to the alert device and start the queue.
        Note: this method can be called only once per real instanced alert device.
        Parameters:
        alertConfig - alert configuration data
        retryAttemptSecondsArray - used for error handling: array of seconds to wait before a new retry attempt is made to transmit a notification again (used if the first attempt fails)
        See Also:
        AlertTransmitQueue.addNotification(AlertConfigGenericNotification genericNotification)

      • stopAlertTransmitQueue

        public void stopAlertTransmitQueue()
        Transient: stop the alert transmit queue of the alert device.
        Note: the stop of the queue will be delayed until the queue is empty.

      • getAlertTransmitQueue

        public AlertTransmitQueue getAlertTransmitQueue()
        Transient: return the alert transmit queue for this alert device.
        Returns:
        the alert transmit queue for this alert device, or null if no alert transmit queue is available - which means that startAlertTransmitQueue(..) never was called.

      • deviceSupportsMessageTextHTML

        public abstract boolean deviceSupportsMessageTextHTML()
        Return if the device supports to send messages in HTML format.
        Returns:
        true if the device supports to send messages in HTML format

      • deviceEnabled

        public boolean deviceEnabled()
        Return if the device is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if the device is enabled

      • setDeviceEnabled

        public void setDeviceEnabled(boolean deviceEnabled)
        Enable or disable the device.
        Parameters:
        deviceEnabled - true if the device is now enabled.

      • getDeviceDescription

        public abstract java.lang.String getDeviceDescription()
        Return the name or description of the alert device.
        Returns:
        the name or description of the alert device

      • deviceIsReady

        public abstract boolean deviceIsReady()
        Return if the device is configured and in a state that it can be used.
        Returns:
        true if the device is configured and in a state that it can be used. Note: this return value is irrespective of if the device is enabled or not.

      • sendNotification

        public abstract AlertConfigGenericDeviceTransmissionTranscript sendNotification(AlertConfig alertConfig,
                                                              AlertConfigGenericNotification genericNotification)
        Transmit an alert notification and return the transcript about the transmission.
        Note: this method must also be able to transmit an AlertConfigGenericCancelableNotification. The real implementation must use instanceof to check for cancelable notifications.
        Parameters:
        genericNotification - the alert notification (instanceof AlertConfigGenericNotification or instanceof AlertConfigGenericCancelableNotification)
        Returns:
        the transcript about the transmission
        See Also:
        AlertConfigGenericNotification, AlertConfigGenericCancelableNotification
